data.name: IDS_CreateMyBiblicalTermsQuery
data.value:
In order to add or edit key terms, you have to begin using a local copy of one of the existing key terms list (i.e. a copy generated, for example, from the Paratext "Major Key Terms" or "All Key Terms" lists or one customized by your entity). At this point, you may want to click 'Cancel' here and then click the "Select Key Terms List" button to select one of the other, existing key terms lists to see if the term you want is present in one of them. If you don't find the term in one of those lists and you want to make an editable key terms list that you can add it to, then select the key terms list that you want to start with (i.e. the "Major" or "All" terms list). Once you've chosen a list to start with, then click this button again to merge (or overwrite, if desired) a new version of the 'My Biblical Terms' list that you will be able to edit.
Beware, though, that the local copy of the key terms list will be stored in your project folder and shared with the other team members (so all members have access and can see the key terms you've added). This means that it will be synchronized to the Internet, which may take a long time the first time (for e.g., the 'All Terms' list is 8MB, the 'Major Terms' list is 4MB). Thereafter, it will only synchronize whatever changes you make, so it won't always be time- consuming, but the first time after creating the local copy will. Also, beware that if you overwrite the editable copy of the 'My Biblical Terms' list, you may be overwriting data that another team member has created and added to. So be sure that you discuss this with the rest of the team before overwriting a list

notes has been supplied to the OneStory Editor free of charge. However, a donation
would be much appreciated at: <a href="http://bible.org/donate">http://bible.org/donate</a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>There’s also a community site for creating groups and
sharing about the <span class=SpellE>NetBible</span> at: <a
href="http://users.bible.org">http://users.bible.org</a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

data.value: Follow these steps to use the Adapt It program to translate the story from {1} into {2}:{0}{0}1) Switch to the Adapt It program using Alt+Tab keys{0}2) Select the '{3}' project and click the 'Next' button (if a file is already open in Adapt It, then choose the 'File' menu, 'Close Project' command and then the 'File' menu, 'Start Working' command first).{0}3) Select the '{4}.xls' document to open and press the 'Finished' button.{0}4) When you see the {1} in the adaptation window, then translate it into {2}. {0}5) When you're finished, return to this window and click the 'Yes' button to import the back-translated {2} text into the {2} fields.{0}{0}Have you finished back-translating the {1} to {2} in Adapt It, and are ready to import it back into the OneStory Editor?

data.name: StageTransition20Update
data.value:
<StateTransition stage="eProjFacTypeFreeTranslation" MemberTypeWithEditToken="eProjectFacilitator" RequiresUsingFreeTranslation="true"> <StageDisplayString>Project Facilitator enters Free Translation</StageDisplayString> <TransitionDisplayString>enter the Free Translation</TransitionDisplayString> <StageInstructions> In this stage, you (the project facilitator) will enter the Free translation (FT) of the story. This Free Translation should be done by a UNS directly and you (the project facilitator) will just type in what they say.
When you are finished entering the Free translation, then click the "Select State" menu item and in the resulting window click on the next (green) state. </StageInstructions> <AllowableForewardsTransitions> <AllowableTransition>eProjFacAddAnchors</AllowableTransition> <AllowableTransition>eConsultantCheckNonBiblicalStory</AllowableTransition> </AllowableForewardsTransitions> <ViewSettings viewVernacularLangField="true" viewNationalLangField="true" viewEnglishBTField="true" viewFreeTranslationField="true" viewAnchorField="false" viewStoryTestingQuestions="false" viewStoryTestingAnswers="false" viewRetellingField="false" viewConsultantNoteField="false" viewCoachNotesField="false" viewNetBible="false" /> </StateTransition>
